eq: Compares to a passed value, and moves on if it's the same. Used with "then" and "else"
ne: Compares to a passed value, and moves on if it is not the same. Used with "then" and "else"
gte: Compares to a passed value, and moves on if it is greater than or equal to the value. Used with "then" and "else".
lte: Compares to a passed value, and moves on if it is less then or equal to the value. Used with "then" and "else".
gt: Compares to a passed value, and moves on if it is greater than the value. Used with "then" and "else".
lt: Compares to a passed value, and moves on if it is less than the value. Used with "then" and "else".
ismember: Checks if the user is a member of the specified group(s).
or: Can be used to string output modifiers together with an "OR" relationship.
and: Can be used to string output modifiers together with an "AND" relationship.
hide: Will check earlier conditions, and hide the element if the conditions were met.
show: Will check earlier conditions, and show the element if the conditions were met.
cat: Appends the option's value (if not empty) to the input value
lcase: Transforms strings to lowercase. Similar to PHP's strtolower
ucase: Transforms strings to uppercase. Similar to PHP's strtoupper
ucwords: Transforms the first letter of a word to uppercase. Similar to PHP's ucwords
ucfirst: Transforms the first letter of the string to uppercase. Similar to PHP's ucfirst
htmlent: Replaces any character that has an HTML entity with that entity. Similar to PHP's htmlentities. Uses the current value the system setting "modx_charset" with flag ENT_QUOTES
esc: Safely escapes character values using regex and str_replace. Also escapes [, ] and `
strip: Replaces all linebreaks, tabs and multiple spaces with just one space
notags: Removes HTML tags from the input. Optionally accepts a value to indicate which tags to allow. Similar to PHP's strip_tags
length: Counts the length of the passed string. Similar to PHP's strlen
reverse: Reverses the input, character by character. Similar to PHP's strrev
wordwrap: Inserts a newline character after the set amount of characters. Similar to PHP's wordwrap. Takes optional value to set wordwrap position.
wordwrapcut: Inserts a newline character after the set amount of characters, irrespective of word boundaries. Similar to PHP's wordwrap, with word cutting enabled. Takes optional value to set wordwrap position.
limit: Limits a string to a certain number of characters. Defaults to 100.
ellipsis: Adds an ellipsis to and truncates a string if it's longer than a certain number of characters. Defaults to 100.
tag: Displays the raw element without the :tag. Useful for documentation.
divide: Returns input divided by option (default: /2) Does not accept 0.
modulus: Returns the option modulus on input (default: %2, returns 0 or 1)
default: Returns the input value if empty
ifnotempty: Returns the input value if not empty
nl2br:
Converts a new line character (
) to an html element. Use this if you're taking in input, you think that there should be new lines in it, and there aren't. Similar to PHP's nl2br.
date: Formats a unix timestamp into a different format. Similar to PHP's strftime. Value is format. See Date Formats.
strtotime: Converts a date string into a unix timestamp. Useful to combine this with the date output filter. Similar to PHP's strtotime. Takes in a date. See Date Formats.
fuzzydate: Returns a pretty date format with yesterday and today being filtered. Takes in a date.
ago: Returns a pretty date format in seconds, minutes, weeks or months ago. Takes in a date (strtotime).
md5: Creates an MD5 hash of the input string. Similar to PHP's md5.
cdata: Wraps the text with CDATA tags
userinfo: Returns the requested user data. The element must be a modUser ID. The value field is the column to grab, e.g. fullname, email. See Examples below.
isloggedin: Returns true if user is authenticated in this context.
isnotloggedin: Returns true if user is not authenticated in this context.
urlencode: Converts the input into a URL-friendly string similar to how an HTML form would do so. Similar to PHP's urlencode
urldecode: Converts the input from an URL-friendly string Similar to PHP's urldecode
toPlaceholder: Puts the input value into the passed placeholder. Does not prevent the output of the value, so add :notempty=`` if you don't want to output the value.
cssToHead: Put a element into the head tag, where the input value is placed inside the href attribute. UsesmodX.regClientCSS.
htmlToHead: Insert a block of HTML code into the of the page, usually right before the . UsesmodX.regClientStartupHTMLBlock
htmlToBottom: Insert HTML code into the bottom of the page, before . Uses modX.regClientHTMLBlock.
jsToHead: Insert JS code (or a link) into the head tag (before the closing head tag). UsesmodX.regClientStartupScript.
jsToBottom: Insert JS code (or a link) before the closing body tag of the page. Uses modX.regClientScript.
